definition: to need urgently/to need doing without delay
to wait/to treat/to deal with/to need/going to (do sth)/about to/intending to

sentences.english: There are a lot of problems to solve.
sentences.chinese: 人工鱼礁增殖技术中有好多急待解决的问题。

sentences.english: The problem of "four capabilities" must be solved as soon as possible in the corrent industry of the ammunition.
sentences.chinese: “四性”问题已成为通用弹药行业急待解决的问题。

sentences.english: It was impatient to solve the low survival rate of direct seeding.
sentences.chinese: 梭梭直播造林成功率很低，是急待解决的问题。

sentences.english: The competition arena is badly in need of repairs.
sentences.chinese: 这个比赛场地急待修缮。

sentences.english: On Christmas Day children can't wait to open their socks to see gifts.
sentences.chinese: 圣诞节那天，孩子们都迫不急待地打开袜子看礼物。

sentences.english: But 2010 was a year in serious need of a tune-up.
sentences.chinese: 但2010年却是急待调整的一年。

sentences.english: I can ' t wait to know the answer.
sentences.chinese: 我迫不急待地想知道答案。

sentences.english: I jokingly suggest thou sacrifice Isaac and thou immediately runs out to do it.
sentences.chinese: 我开玩笑提议汝将以撒献祭，汝便迫不急待来做。

sentences.english: They were both smiling, and said they could not wait to hold their grandson.
sentences.chinese: 他们两人笑容满面，表示自己迫不急待要去抱孙子。

sentences.english: He (could not) wait to see you.
How to extend the minimal become anxiously meat to solve the problems.
sentences.chinese: 如何延长冷却肉的保鲜期成为急待解决的问题。

definition: to be keen to .../to be anxious to ...
to burn one's eyebrows/fig. desperately serious situation
to need the toilet/urinary or defecatory urgency
to look forward eagerly to sth/keenly desired
lit. as hurried as a shooting star (idiom); requiring immediate action/extremely urgent
three, set five remove two (abacus rule)/efficiently/quickly and easily
variant of 一股腦兒|一股脑儿[yi1 gu3 nao3 r5]
(idiom) with everyone lending a hand (eagerly but somewhat chaotically)
